title: Quiz 7: Physical Examination Techniques
description: Assess your knowledge on percussion, auscultation, and specific body system exams.

questions.question: Match the percussion sound with the underlying tissue:
questions.explanation: Resonance=lung; Dullness=solid/fluid; Tympany=hollow organ; Hyper-resonance=trapped air.

questions.question: What is the correct position for a female pelvic examination?
questions.explanation: Lithotomy position (knees flexed and apart) allows proper inspection of genitalia.

questions.question: Jaundice is best seen in the sclera of the eyes and mucous membranes.
questions.explanation: Jaundice (yellowing) is most visible in the white of the eyes (sclera).

questions.question: The 'Apex Beat' (PMI) is normally located at the ___BLANK___ intercostal space, mid-clavicular line.
questions.explanation: The Point of Maximum Impulse is usually at the 5th ICS, Mid-clavicular line.

questions.question: Which breath sound is described as a 'high-pitched hissing sound' originating in small air passages?
questions.explanation: Wheezes are high-pitched musical/hissing sounds (asthma). Rhonchi are low-pitched.

questions.question: Order the sequence of Abdominal Examination to prevent altering bowel sounds:
questions.explanation: For the abdomen, Auscultation comes second. Touching (palpation/percussion) can stimulate false bowel sounds.

questions.question: When examining the breast, which of the following techniques should be used? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Inspect with arms raised over head
Squeeze the nipple to check for discharge

questions.explanation: All listed techniques are part of a comprehensive breast exam.

questions.question: What is the term for the vibration felt on the chest wall when a patient speaks?
questions.explanation: Tactile fremitus is the palpable vibration transmitted through the bronchopulmonary tree to the chest wall.

questions.question: Shifting dullness in the abdomen is a sign of ascites (fluid).
questions.explanation: Shifting dullness indicates free fluid moving in the abdominal cavity.

questions.question: Which finding during a male genital exam would suggest a hernia?

options.text: Bulge in the inguinal ring when coughing

questions.explanation: A bulge in the inguinal area that appears or enlarges on coughing/straining suggests an inguinal hernia.
